page.title: 06THE POST OFFICE.
page.content: { The post office}is in a building which is about three hundred years old. For a hundred years it was a pub but was then converted into a shop. Below it is a large cellar were barrels of beer were once stored, together with the chute used to roll them down. The current owners have been there for seven years; they sell{stamps, {sweets}and{groceries.}First class stamps (17p) are most in demand. About a hundred{letters}are posted each day, most to addresses in this country. Friday is the busiest day as{pensions are dealt with then and the books balanced. People can pay their {electricity bills}or buy{TV licence {stamps;}about fifty pounds worth are sold each month. Over two hundred {newspapers}are sold every day _ eleven different ones are available.
